shared_text: Weekly Update with Dr. Tim Newman
text:
Please join Superintendent Dr. Tim Newman for his weekly update!

Weekly Update with Dr. Tim Newman

post_text:
For Immediate Release: September 9, 2020

DCSD Delays School Decision

The Darlington County School District will wait until the Sept. 14 Darlington County Board of Education meeting to decide whether students will continue eLearning or return to in-person learning on Sept. 21.

“We are continuing to watch the numbers,” said Dr. Tim Newman, superintendent. “As of Monday’s DHEC report, Darlington County is rated HIGH, which would seem to indicate that we continue with eLearning. But the trend shows a clear and regular decline in cases, which may indicate we can return to in-person school. We want to return to in-person learning as soon as safely possible to do so, and we hope this delay will allow us to gather more data to make the best decision.”

DCSD students not enrolled in the Darlington County Virtual Academy began the school year on Tuesday, Sept. 8, in the eLearning format. That will continue through Sept. 18. How schools provide instruction after that will depend on the Board’s decision at its board meeting.

##
text:
For Immediate Release: September 9, 2020

DCSD Delays School Decision

The Darlington County School District will wait until the Sept. 14 Darlington County Board of Education meeting to decide whether students will continue eLearning or return to in-person learning on Sept. 21.

“We are continuing to watch the numbers,” said Dr. Tim Newman, superintendent. “As of Monday’s DHEC report, Darlington County is rated HIGH, which would seem to indicate that we continue with eLearning. But the trend shows a clear and regular decline in cases, which may indicate we can return to in-person school. We want to return to in-person learning as soon as safely possible to do so, and we hope this delay will allow us to gather more data to make the best decision.”

DCSD students not enrolled in the Darlington County Virtual Academy began the school year on Tuesday, Sept. 8, in the eLearning format. That will continue through Sept. 18. How schools provide instruction after that will depend on the Board’s decision at its board meeting.

##

post_text:
The Hartsville Boys & Girls Club is offering a Community Learning Center for 1st-5th graders. We will continue to post contact information for other Community Learning Centers as they become available. Visit the Community Learning Center Connection page at www.dcsdschools.org over the coming days as we add more organizations to the list.

To register your child, reach out to the Club directly (information below).

Organization Name: Hartsville Boys and Girls Club
Contact: Dianne Montgomery
Phone Number: 843-332-1400
Address: 1103 S. Sixth Street, Hartsville
Days of Operation: M-F
Time of Operation: 7:30 a.m. -6:00 p.m.
Serving Grades: 1-5
Number of students able to serve: 74
Cost: $10 per week, per child

Community Learning Centers are operated separately from the Darlington County School District and are a service to our students offered completely independent of the District by the organizations offering the Centers.

post_text: So that our parents may make arrangements for their children, please let us know by tomorrow, September 1, if your organization is offering a FREE Community Learning Center to our students. Visit www.dcsdschools.org and click on the Community Learning Center Connection for more information and to complete the interest form.

Weekly Update with Dr. Tim Newman

post_text:
If your organization is willing and able to host a Community Learning Center for free for students (5 years or older per DSS) to attend during COVID-19 closures, visit www.dcsdschools.org and complete the sign-up form.

Community Learning Centers will provide a place for students to go to complete school work. This will also help working families who need childcare. We will be in contact with you soon about the next steps.

In the meantime, please visit the SC Child Care website to learn more about DSS regulations (https://www.scchildcare.org/departments/child-care-licensing/temporary-permit-to-operate.aspx).

Please note that the school district will provide meals for students at Community Learning Centers.
text:

post_text:
REMINDER: Darlington-Lee Adult Education is holding fall session pre-registration for students from Darlington, Hartsville, Lamar and Society Hill Aug. 26-27. The pre-registration events on those days will be held from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. each day. Students must attend one of those days if they plan to attend the fall session.

Students from Bishopville will register either for Morning Sessions from 9 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. on Sept. 1-3 (must attend all three days) or for Evening Sessions from 5-8 p.m. on Sept. 1-2 (must attend both evenings). Students from Bishopville do not need to attend the pre-registration events on Aug. 25-27.

MORE INFO --> http://www.dcsdschools.org/about_us/latest_news/darlington-_lee_adult_education_announces
